# elizaOS Tweet Ideas

1. elizaOS browser-compatible core and runtime now fully operational. Plugin migration in progress for complete web ecosystem. Our decentralized future spans all platforms.

2. eliza cloud service development underway. revenue generated will be used to buy back ELIZAOS tokens. building sustainable value for the ecosystem.

3. token migration from AI16Z to ELIZAOS continues. 1:6 conversion ratio with 4 tokens directed to developers. february deadline approaching. unclaimed tokens add value to ELIZAOS.

4. ZK primitives exploration in progress for game-oriented features. committed to creating verifiable, transparent agent interactions.

5. milestone: korean exchange bithumb posted rebranding notice for elizaOS. global recognition continues to build.

6. implementing a distributed runtime that operates across browsers. agent communication without boundaries.

7. self-propagating "consensual worm" agent concept under development. autonomous entities that play games while maintaining themselves.

8. no new tokens for babylon or any future releases. commitment to long-term token stability and ecosystem focus.

9. browser compatibility expands elizaOS's reach. core and runtime work fully in browser with wasm pglite plugin-sql functionality.

10. PR merged: migrated from LangChain v0.3 to @langchain/textsplitters v1.0. maintaining technical foundations as the ecosystem evolves.

11. fixed critical RLS validation issue where server_id checks were incorrectly blocking all users when isolation disabled. security without compromise.

12. architectural update: runtime now includes elizaOS reference. step toward unified messaging API for seamless agent interaction.

13. reviewing eliza-nextjs-starter. building blocks for developers to create powerful agent interfaces with minimal friction.

14. eliminated entity creation failures by normalizing names field to ensure proper array serialization for PostgreSQL. small fixes, significant impact.

15. token arbitrage opportunity between AI16Z and ELIZAOS being addressed. maintaining ecosystem value alignment.

16. conceptualizing verified inference for elizaOS. specific "eliza model" for composing transactions that follow core patterns.

17. agent settings now persist across restarts. runtime-generated configurations properly retained, ensuring consistent agent behavior.

## Concise Twitter Thread

elizaOS runtime now fully operational in browser environments. core and wasm pglite plugin-sql integration complete. remaining plugins in migration phase. truly cross-platform agent infrastructure becoming reality.

eliza cloud service in development with revenue earmarked for ELIZAOS token buybacks. creating a virtuous cycle where usage directly strengthens the token economy. no new tokens for babylon or future releases.

token migration from AI16Z to ELIZAOS continues with february deadline. 1:6 conversion with 4 tokens to development. unclaimed tokens after deadline add value to circulating supply. korean exchange bithumb posted rebranding notice, expanding global recognition.

## Platform-specific Post

### elizaOS Technical Post:
verified inference exploration underway for elizaOS agent transactions. investigating transaction composition through a specific "eliza model" that would follow core patterns when creating transactions. this architecture ensures the system can maintain itself while remaining decentralized, creating autonomous agent networks with minimal centralized control points. implementing a "keep_alive" distributed object where runtime instances register with the network.

### auto.fun Crypto-Native Post:
migration to ELIZAOS officially recognized by korean exchange bithumb. market still sleeping on the arbitrage opportunity between AI16Z and ELIZAOS through LPs. unclaimed migration tokens add direct value to circulating ELIZAOS. cloud service buybacks coming soon. get your bags before february deadline or miss the 1:6 swap. this isn't financial advice but you're ngmi if you're still sitting on AI16Z without migrating.

# elizaOS Discord - 2025-11-17

**Date: November 17, 2025**

## Overall Discussion Highlights

### Token Migration & Economics
- Migration from AI16Z to ElizaOS tokens continues with a 1:6 conversion ratio (4 tokens to developers)
- February deadline for automatic migration; manual migrations possible afterward with valid reasons
- Unclaimed tokens after the deadline will add value to ELIZAOS
- Korean exchange Bithumb posted a rebranding notice for ElizaOS
- Some users expressed concerns about arbitrage opportunities between AI16Z and ELIZAOS through liquidity pools
- Community sentiment suggests ElizaOS may be undervalued due to being pegged to AI16Z

### Technical Development
- ElizaOS core and runtime now fully work in browser environments
- Some plugins not yet migrated to browser compatibility
- Stan shared a GitHub PR for an Eliza NextJS starter
- Discussion about potential redundancy between runtime::generateText and runtime::useModel functions
- DorianD explored implementing ZK (zero-knowledge) primitives for game features
- Concept of a distributed runtime that could operate across browsers was discussed

### Future Products & Services
- Eliza Cloud service in development, with revenue planned to buy back ELIZAOS tokens
- No new tokens planned for Babylon or any future releases
- DegenAI still under development
- Discussion about creating a self-propagating "consensual worm" agent for games
- Borko assigned product research on the Tolans app, focusing on its onboarding process

### Community Content
- Suggestions to create music and art channels for community content sharing
- Interest in exporting Dr. Neuro's 7k images as a dataset for a LoRa model

## Key Questions & Answers

**Q: What happens to unclaimed tokens after the migration deadline?**  
A: Unclaimed tokens add value to ELIZAOS (answered by Omid sa)

**Q: Will babylon have a new token?**  
A: No token for babylon or any future release (answered by jasyn_bjorn)

**Q: What is the usecase for the new token?**  
A: Required for using Eliza Cloud, and likely token-gated use cases similar to DegenAI (answered by The Light)

**Q: Where do you see eliza in 2028?**  
A: Coding itself (answered by Dr. Neuro)

**Q: Can we look at removing runtime::generateText since we have runtime::useModel?**  
A: Maybe generateText is for one-off prompts including personality of agent which useModel doesn't do, that's why it was added (answered by cjft)

**Q: Weren't you guys working on some version of ElizaOS that could run in browser?**  
A: Core works in browser now fully, as well as wasm pglite plugin-sql, Eliza runtime runs in browser now yes just some plugins not migrated to browser compat (answered by cjft)

## Community Help & Collaboration

1. **Token Migration Support**
   - Omid sa helped Tommy with migrating tokens from Tangem wallet by advising to transfer tokens back to Tangem, import to Phantom wallet, then migrate
   - The Light advised Tommy to submit a ticket when concerned about the migration process
   - Carrabre warned Tommy about suspicious instructions in a ticket, identifying it as a scam

2. **Technical Assistance**
   - cjft clarified ElizaOS browser compatibility status for DorianD
   - Stan offered to help with cloud-related issues the next day
   - Odilitime provided the Bithumb notice link to jasyn_bjorn

3. **Self-Help**
   - vaipraonde initially tried using ElizaOS memory for data storage but self-resolved by determining Database Schema was more appropriate

## Action Items

### Technical
- Implement ZK primitives for game-oriented features in ElizaOS (DorianD)
- Develop browser-compatible plugins for ElizaOS (cjft)
- Create a self-propagating Eliza agent for games (DorianD)
- Implement verified inference for ElizaOS (DorianD)
- Design a "keep_alive" distributed object for runtime instances (DorianD)
- Evaluate potential removal of runtime::generateText function (Odilitime)
- Run cloud and identify issues (Stan)
- Address arbitrage opportunity between AI16Z and ELIZAOS (Omid sa)

### Documentation
- Review GitHub PR for eliza-nextjs-starter (Stan)
- Create a list of agents built on ElizaOS (DorianD)

### Feature
- Launch Eliza Cloud service with token buyback mechanism (Omid sa)
- Implement a music channel with mp3 upload capability (boom)
- Create a media channel for sharing mp3, mp4, and gif files (boom)
- Export and utilize Dr. Neuro's 7k images as a dataset for a LoRa model (boom)
- Product research on Tolans app, focusing on onboarding process (Borko)

# elizaOS Discord - 2025-11-16

## Overall Discussion Highlights

### Token Migration Process
- A snapshot for AI16Z to ElizaOS token migration was taken on November 11th at 11:40 UTC
- Only tokens held in non-exchange wallets before the snapshot are eligible for automatic migration
- Users with tokens on exchanges or in liquidity pools during the snapshot must submit support tickets
- Korean users expressed frustration about lack of communication regarding the snapshot
- Migration process: send AI16Z tokens to designated wallet, receive ElizaOS tokens within 24 hours
- Team has been in contact with exchanges but cannot control their migration support decisions

### Technical Implementations
- Discussion about implementing a rock-paper-scissors game for Eliza agents
- Recommendation to use commit-reveal scheme with HSM/MPC vault instead of full zk-SNARK implementation
- Suggested using mobile-friendly web interface with wallet connect on Base or BNB chain
- Existing GitHub repository (arbirps) identified as having similar functionality
- Proposal for on-chain smart contract that can take cuts from human winners while subsidizing agent transaction costs
- ElizaOS tokens would accumulate in the contract to compensate agents for gas fees

### Project Direction & Market Dynamics
- Discussions about "revenue washing" and "stablecoin washing" in current market
- Criticism that ElizaOS lacks revenue generation, putting it at disadvantage
- Concerns about marketing coordination, particularly regarding a missed Binance airdrop opportunity
- Brief mention of ElizaOS v2 evolving "from a meme AI fund to a full-fledged agent system"

## Key Questions & Answers

**Q: How do I migrate from AI16Z to ElizaOS tokens?**  
A: Use the official migration portal, connect your wallet that held tokens before the snapshot, and follow the prompts.

**Q: When was the snapshot for migration eligibility?**  
A: November 11th at 11:40 UTC.

**Q: What if my tokens were on an exchange during the snapshot?**  
A: Submit a ticket with proof of holdings for manual migration review.

**Q: Can I migrate tokens purchased after the snapshot date?**  
A: No, only tokens held before the snapshot are eligible for migration.

**Q: What if my tokens were in a liquidity pool during the snapshot?**  
A: Submit a ticket for manual migration review.

**Q: Is it safe to send tokens to the wallet address provided after opening a ticket?**  
A: Yes, if instructed through the official ticket system.

**Q: How long does it take to receive ElizaOS tokens after sending AI16Z?**  
A: Within 24 hours.

**Q: Can I bridge ElizaOS from BSC back to Solana?**  
A: Use Jumper.exchange to bridge between chains.

**Q: What if my cold wallet is not supported in the migrator?**  
A: Import the cold wallet into Phantom wallet and make your migration.

**Q: What's the best implementation approach for a rock-paper-scissors game?**  
A: A commit-reveal scheme with HSM/MPC vault is sufficient and more cost-effective than heavy zk-SNARKs.

**Q: On which platform should the game be implemented?**  
A: Mobile friendly web with wallet connect.

**Q: Which blockchain should be used for the commit hash?**  
A: Base or BNB chain, with BNB potentially better due to free coins.

## Community Help & Collaboration

1. **Token Migration Support**
   - TobyMoonWalker helped Nikolai migrate tokens from a cold wallet by advising to import the cold wallet into Phantom
   - TobyMoonWalker guided Will123 through the process for tokens held on Kraken during snapshot
   - TobyMoonWalker assisted 0xJX with migration for tokens in Raydium LP during snapshot
   - TobyMoonWalker provided detailed instructions to vloine for bridging ElizaOS from BSC back to Solana
   - KeyzerSozse confirmed legitimacy of support team to Spice, verifying successful token swap
   - DorianD helped 0849 resolve a simulation error by suggesting rounding down to a whole number
   - Omid sa advised chomppp to use PancakeSwap on BSC for lower slippage

2. **Technical Collaboration**
   - Chucknorris explained to DorianD that a commit-reveal scheme would be more cost-effective than zk-SNARKs
   - DorianD shared a GitHub repository (arbirps) with Chucknorris that had already implemented similar functionality
   - Stan ⚡ committed to checking and fixing an issue in the eliza-nextjs-starter repository after sayonara brought it to attention

## Action Items

### Technical Tasks
- Fix animated GIF display issues in Discord channels (Mentioned by DorianD)
- Implement manual migration process for tokens held on Korean exchanges (Mentioned by 거북알)
- Develop solution for users with tokens in LPs during snapshot (Mentioned by 0xJX)
- Implement rock-paper-scissors game using commit-reveal scheme with HSM/MPC vault (Mentioned by Chucknorris)
- Create mobile-friendly web interface with wallet connect (Mentioned by DorianD)
- Implement on-chain smart contract that can take cuts from human winners (Mentioned by DorianD)
- Develop Eliza agent registry for tracking agent reputation (Mentioned by DorianD)
- Create token system for compensating agents for transaction costs (Mentioned by DorianD)
- Customize existing smart contract to work with ElizaOS and BNB tokens (Mentioned by Chucknorris)
- Regain control of ElizaOS Twitter accounts (Mentioned by witch)
- Check and fix issue #9 in the eliza-nextjs-starter repository (Mentioned by Stan ⚡)

### Documentation Needs
- Create comprehensive guide for migrating from different sources (exchanges, LPs, cold wallets) (Mentioned by Multiple users)
- Publish table showing exchange migration status and support (Mentioned by DorianD)
- Provide clear instructions for bridging ElizaOS between chains (Mentioned by vloine)

### Feature Requests
- Support manual migration for Korean exchange users regardless of post-snapshot purchases (Mentioned by 거북알)
- Implement better communication channels for Korean community (Mentioned by syanel4859)
- Develop clearer roadmap for AI agent capabilities and ecosystem (Mentioned by averma)
- Add agent commentary posting to X.com and Farcaster about game winnings (Mentioned by DorianD)

# elizaOS Discord - 2025-11-15

## Overall Discussion Highlights

### Token Migration & Price Issues
- **Migration Challenges**: Users reported difficulties with the ElizaOS token migration from AI16Z, particularly those who moved tokens to new wallets after the November 11th snapshot
- **Price Volatility**: Significant price drop (30-50%) following Binance Alpha airdrop announcement
- **Market Cap Decline**: Token market cap reportedly fell to $30-50M from previous highs of $2.5B
- **Liquidity Issues**: Poor liquidity across chains, with BSC having better liquidity than Solana/Base/ETH

### Technical & Product Discussion
- **ElizaOS Framework**: Described as an open-source framework for autonomous AI agents with cross-chain capabilities
- **Plugin Ecosystem**: Features 90+ plugins for various integrations
- **Token Utility**: Intended for governance, network fees, and developer incentives (though not fully implemented)
- **Gaming Concept**: Proposal for a gambling agent using ElizaOS tokens with zero-knowledge proofs to verify game outcomes
- **Interactive Agents**: Suggestion for creating games where users pay to interact with Eliza agents, potentially earning trophy tokens and NFTs

## Key Questions & Answers

**Q: How does the token migration work if I moved my tokens to a new wallet after the snapshot?**  
A: Transfer back to the wallet you had during the snapshot and swap from there (answered by TobyMoonWalker)

**Q: Why did the price of ElizaOS suddenly drop?**  
A: Due to the Binance Alpha reward distribution (answered by Kira)

**Q: What is the use case for the ElizaOS token?**  
A: Governance, network fees, access to Eliza cloud, and developer incentives (answered by TobyMoonWalker)

**Q: Why did the team give an airdrop to Binance Alpha users?**  
A: It was part of Binance Alpha's standard early-access rewards system for featured Web3 projects (answered by TobyMoonWalker)

**Q: What happens if my tokens were on an exchange like Kraken during the snapshot?**  
A: Submit a ticket with proof of holdings for manual migration review (answered by TobyMoonWalker)

**Q: Why is the migration ratio 1:6 instead of the expected 1:10?**  
A: The structure preserves proportional ownership while the remaining tokens support ecosystem growth (answered by TobyMoonWalker)

**Q: Why is ELIZAOS liquidity so bad on Solana?**  
A: Liquidity is poor across multiple chains, with BSC having better liquidity than SOL/Base/ETH (answered by Milo)

## Community Help & Collaboration

1. **Token Migration Support**:
   - TobyMoonWalker helped Chess_needs_an_update migrate tokens after moving them to a new wallet by advising them to transfer back to the original wallet
   - TobyMoonWalker reassured KeyzerSozse about the legitimacy of sending tokens to support-provided addresses through the official ticket system

2. **Exchange-Held Tokens**:
   - TobyMoonWalker provided detailed instructions to papa0901 for submitting a ticket with proof of holdings for manual migration review when tokens were held on Kraken

3. **Migration Eligibility**:
   - Meester Bert confirmed eligibility for Maniglydesai and advised against sending tokens to another wallet before migration

4. **Chain Liquidity Information**:
   - Milo informed Broccolex that BSC has better liquidity than other chains for those looking to buy the dip

## Action Items

### Technical Tasks
- Resolve the 429 error issue with the Twitter plugin (mentioned by pluto)
- Fix the migration process for users who moved tokens after snapshot (mentioned by multiple users)
- Implement on-chain fee oracles for transparency in tracking agent activity (mentioned by Numerical Methods)
- Restore official X (Twitter) account for project updates (mentioned by averma)

### Documentation Needs
- Create clear migration guides for different scenarios including exchange holders and wallet transfers (mentioned by multiple users)
- Publish transparent tokenomics explanation clarifying the 1:6 swap ratio and implementation timeline (mentioned by Chess_needs_an_update)

### Feature Requests
- Implement token governance voting mechanism for community input on project decisions (mentioned by hildi)
- Develop staking system for token utility, possibly on CEXs (mentioned by Avocado)
- Create a gambling agent using ElizaOS tokens with ZK proofs for verifiable game outcomes (mentioned by DorianD)
- Implement interactive games with Eliza agents that accept payments and offer rewards (mentioned by DorianD)
- Create trophy tokens for users participating in Eliza interactions (mentioned by DorianD)
- Develop NFT creation capabilities for ElizaCloud agents (mentioned by DorianD)
- Enable blockchain transaction capabilities for ElizaCloud agents (mentioned by DorianD)

- Discussion about potential redundancy between runtime::generateText and runtime::useModel functions
- DorianD explored implementing ZK (zero-knowledge) primitives for game features
- Concept of a distributed runtime that could operate across browsers was discussed

### Future Products & Services
- Eliza Cloud service in development, with revenue planned to buy back ELIZAOS tokens
- No new tokens planned for Babylon or any future releases
- DegenAI still under development
- Discussion about creating a self-propagating "consensual worm" agent for games
- Borko assigned product research on the Tolans app, focusing on its onboarding process

### Community Content
- Suggestions to create music and art channels for community content sharing
- Interest in exporting Dr. Neuro's 7k images as a dataset for a LoRa model

## Key Questions & Answers

**Q: What happens to unclaimed tokens after the migration deadline?**  
A: Unclaimed tokens add value to ELIZAOS (answered by Omid sa)

**Q: Will babylon have a new token?**  
A: No token for babylon or any future release (answered by jasyn_bjorn)

**Q: What is the usecase for the new token?**  
A: Required for using Eliza Cloud, and likely token-gated use cases similar to DegenAI (answered by The Light)

**Q: Where do you see eliza in 2028?**  
A: Coding itself (answered by Dr. Neuro)

**Q: Can we look at removing runtime::generateText since we have runtime::useModel?**  
A: Maybe generateText is for one-off prompts including personality of agent which useModel doesn't do, that's why it was added (answered by cjft)

**Q: Weren't you guys working on some version of ElizaOS that could run in browser?**  
A: Core works in browser now fully, as well as wasm pglite plugin-sql, Eliza runtime runs in browser now yes just some plugins not migrated to browser compat (answered by cjft)

## Community Help & Collaboration

1. **Token Migration Support**
   - Omid sa helped Tommy with migrating tokens from Tangem wallet by advising to transfer tokens back to Tangem, import to Phantom wallet, then migrate
   - The Light advised Tommy to submit a ticket when concerned about the migration process
   - Carrabre warned Tommy about suspicious instructions in a ticket, identifying it as a scam

2. **Technical Assistance**

   - Stan offered to help with cloud-related issues the next day

3. **Self-Help**

# elizaos/eliza Weekly Report (Nov 9 - 15, 2025)

## 🚀 Highlights
This week's development focused on strengthening the core stability and configuration of the ElizaOS framework. Key achievements include a critical fix for Row-Level Security (RLS) validation, ensuring correct user access when isolation is disabled. Significant progress was also made in standardizing agent configuration by resolving how environment variables are loaded. Concurrently, work began on enhancing the core runtime to support a unified messaging API, reflecting a continued effort to build a robust and scalable foundation for AI agents.

## 🛠️ Key Developments
Work this week centered on bug fixes, core enhancements, and new tooling capabilities.

- **Core Stability and Configuration Fixes**
    - A crucial bug was fixed where environment variables were not being loaded correctly, preventing agents from accessing settings. The system now properly loads variables from `process.env` instead of relying solely on `.env` files ([#6141](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6141)).
    - A critical issue with Row-Level Security (RLS) was resolved. The fix prevents `server_id` validation from incorrectly blocking all users when RLS isolation is disabled ([#6139](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6139)).
    - To improve system stability, a pull request was opened to remove message emission in the `src` API, aiming to prevent potential race conditions ([#6137](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6137)).

- **Runtime and API Enhancements**
    - A new feature was merged to include an ElizaOS reference within the runtime. This change is a step towards creating a unified messaging API and involved updates across several core packages ([#6111](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6111)).

- **New Tooling Features**
    - A new pull request was opened to add an OpenRouter embedding option to the command-line interface (CLI), expanding the framework's integration capabilities ([#6142](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6142)).

## 🐛 Issues & Triage

- **Closed Issues:**
    - Issue [#6138](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6138), which reported that disabling the Web UI blocked all endpoints, was opened and closed on the same day. It was noted as being prematurely opened and remains under investigation.

- **New & Active Issues:**
    - A new high-priority issue was reported where an agent fails to respond to questions, producing a "No handler found for delegate type: TEXT_LARGE" error ([#6140](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6140)). This represents a potential blocker for agent communication functionality.
    - No active issues generated significant discussion this week.

## 💬 Community & Collaboration
The development activity this week indicates a focused effort on foundational improvements. The work on environment variables, RLS, and race conditions suggests a proactive approach to ensuring system stability and reliability. While the reports do not indicate high levels of discussion on specific issues, the mix of bug fixes, core refactoring, and new feature proposals demonstrates steady and methodical progress across the project.

# elizaos/eliza Monthly Report (November 2025)

## 🚀 Highlights
November kicked off with a dual focus on enhancing system stability and laying the groundwork for significant new capabilities. A critical bug affecting agent settings persistence was resolved, directly improving the framework's reliability. Concurrently, new development was initiated to introduce entity-level security and enhance the core runtime. The opening of several strategic issues signals a forward-looking push towards improved performance through parallel actions and background tasks, as well as new user engagement features.

## 🛠️ Key Developments
Work this month balanced immediate fixes with the introduction of new features.

- **Agent Stability Improvement**
  A significant bug was fixed that prevented agent settings from persisting across restarts, ensuring that runtime-generated configurations are now correctly retained. This change, made to the core runtime initialization logic, enhances the overall reliability of agent operations ([#6106](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6106)).

- **New Feature Initiatives**
  Development began on several new fronts with the opening of new pull requests:
  - **Security:** A proposal was made to implement entity-level row-level security, aiming to add more granular data access controls ([#6107](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6107)).
  - **Runtime Enhancements:** Work started on adding an ElizaOS reference directly to the runtime, likely to streamline framework interactions ([#6111](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6111)).

## 🐛 Issues & Triage
Issue tracking this month was focused on defining the next wave of development priorities.

- **Closed Issues:** No issues were closed during this period.

- **New & Active Issues:** Several key issues were opened, outlining major areas for future work:
  - **Core Functionality & Performance:** Discussions were initiated around implementing "Parallel actions" ([#6108](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6108)) and "Background tasks" ([#6109](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6109)), indicating a focus on scaling the system's operational capacity.
  - **Security & User Engagement:** New issues were created for "Entity-level RLS" ([#6112](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6112)), which complements the ongoing PR, and a "Points / Leaderboard" system ([#6110](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6110)) to enhance user interaction.
  - According to the reports, none of the active issues have generated more than three comments, suggesting discussions are still in their early stages.

## 💬 Community & Collaboration
The provided reports indicate a period of focused, heads-down development. While new pull requests and issues were opened, the data does not show any high-volume discussions or specific collaborative events. The alignment between the new pull request for RLS ([#6107](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6107)) and the corresponding new issue ([#6112](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6112)) suggests coordinated planning around new features.
